intro: Arabis humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It features basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and its flowering period occurs in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
